paper_metadata.title: Corporate participation in targeted poverty alleviation and corporate value: Evidence from Chinese listed companies

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Findings suggest that corporations' active implementation of TPA actions can increase the shareholding ratio of institutional investors and government subsidies and improve corporate reputation, thereby significantly increasing their corporate value
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: This paper is set in the context of the TPA strategy initiated by China, with data manually obtained from the annual reports and CSR reports of listed companies from 2013-2018

bonus_information.cost_mentions: Listed companies donated $9.1 billion to TPA in three years
bonus_information.cost_evidence_citation: Data show that listed companies donated $9.1 billion to TPA in three years and helped 200,000 people get out of poverty

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: This paper focuses on the targeted poverty alleviation (TPA) and investigates the relationship between corporate participation in TPA and its corporate value
evidence_citations.country_citation: In 2016, the Chinese government launched a national campaign to eradicate poverty by 2020
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: Poverty remains the biggest challenge facing the world today. In 2016, the Chinese government launched a national campaign to eradicate poverty by 2020
